meanings.definition: The equality of the size of the retinal images in the two eyes.
meanings.sent1: I learned about iseikonia in my science class.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist checked for iseikonia during the eye exam.
meanings.sent3: The concept of iseikonia made me appreciate the complexity of vision.
meanings.sent4: In the world of optics, iseikonia is like a delicate balance on a tightrope.
meanings.sent5: Understanding iseikonia is crucial for maintaining good eye health.

meanings.definition: The condition in which the retinal images of an object are of unequal size.
meanings.sent1: The patient's vision issue was diagnosed as iseikonia.
meanings.sent2: I read about iseikonia in a book about eye disorders.
meanings.sent3: The iseikonia in the painting gave it a unique and distorted look.
meanings.sent4: Her perception of reality was altered by the iseikonia she experienced.
